intro: Psilostrophe villosa, commonly known as the hairy psilostrophe, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Psilostrophe villosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
